author: ryanleeschneider
content:
We see significant "spikes" in IOPS on our archive nodes every ~2.5h but otherwise the throughput isn't that high (for an idle node not handling RPC traffic), here's a bit of dstat on such a node (not during the spikes):
```
$ sudo dstat --disk --disk-tps
-dsk/total- -dsk/total-
 read  writ|#read #writ
1274k 6171k|  43    78
   0  8192B|   0     2
8192B 8192B|   1     2
   0  8192B|   0     2
   0    16k|   0     4
  24k 8192B|   3     2
  40k   12k|   4     3
8192B 8192B|   1     2
   0  8192B|   0     2
 112k 8192B|  11     2
   0  8192B|   0     2
2400k 8192B| 255     2
 448k 8192B|  47     2
  44k 8192B|   6     2
   0  1556k|   0    18
  60k 1540k|   6    19
   0  8192B|   0     2
8192B 8192B|   1     2
   0  8192B|   0     2
   0  1224k|   0   306
   0  8192B|   0     2
1372k 8192B| 154     2
```

My guess is the spikes are related to leveldb background work but I haven't had time to debug, and they don't seem to be affecting our RPC performance.
